p: Following Halcomb and Davidsonâ€™s [ 31] approach, the field notes from all 76 interviews were then compiled into a 295-page compendium used for the primary analysis which employed grounded theory methods to analyze the data [ 34, 35, 36]. Grounded theory is an inductive process oriented toward building theory that is derived from the data under study [ 37]. The descriptive and explanatory power of this constructivist approach is advantageous in offering an in-depth understanding of current vaccine perceptions and how those perceptions were formed [ 38].
